title: 502. “I Don’t Think the Country Is Turning Away From College.”
description: Enrollment is down for the first time in memory, and critics complain college is too expensive, too elitist, and too politicized. The economist Chris Paxson — who happens to be the president of Brown University — does not agree. (Part 3 of “Freakonomics Radio Goes Back to School.”)
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
